intro: Anchusa spicata, commonly known as spiked bugloss, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces dense spikes of blue to violet flowers, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Anchusa spicata is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to full sun conditions. It is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
